message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.DS 

This paper deals with modeling social media conversations and interactions between users and topics. It incorporates Hidden Markov Models and Hawkes processes to jointly model topical interactions along with user-user and user-topic patterns. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). The paper also deals with natural language processing and text-based cascades, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper proposes a Gibbs sampling algorithm, which falls under cs.SD (Software Engineering). The use of machine learning techniques such as Hidden Markov Models and Hawkes processes suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
